go_data.justification: eIF2 is involved in general translation, which is reduced when eIF2 is phosphorylated by PERK kinase.
As a translation initiation factor, eIF2 is expected to be located in the cytosol where translation occurs.
Phosphorylation of eIF2 by PERK kinase is part of the response to endoplasmic reticulum stress, specifically the unfolded protein response (UPR).
